snippet: David Tarloff’s lawyers had argued that he was too mentally ill to be held criminally responsible for a murder five years ago.
abstract: Murder trial of David Tarloff, schizophrenic man accused of killing psychologist Kathryn Faughey in her Upper East Side office in 2008, ends in mistrial, as jury tells State Supreme Court Justice Edward J McLaughlin that it is hopelessly deadlocked; Tarloff's lawyers argued he was too mentally ill to be held criminally responsible; prosecutors intend to retry him.

byline.original: By RUSS BUETTNER and J. DAVID GOODMAN

lead_paragraph: David Tarloff’s lawyers had argued that he was too mentally ill to be held criminally responsible for a murder five years ago.

headline.seo: Mistrial Declared in Murder Trial of David Tarloff
headline.main: Mistrial Declared in ’08 Killing of Psychologist
headline.print_headline: Mistrial Declared in ’08 Killing of Psychologist
